Roles and Permissions

The Roles and Permissions section defines how users are grouped in Unit Master and which menus, pages and actions each group of users is allowed to access.

What are Roles and Permissions?

In Unit Master, a role is a profile that groups users who have the same responsibilities, such as Operations Officer, Administrator or Call Centre Agent. Instead of configuring access for each user one by one, you configure access for the role and then assign the role to multiple users.

Permissions are the specific menus and actions that a role is allowed to use. For example, a role may be allowed to view accounts, create transactions, but not approve redemptions. By combining roles and permissions, administrators can control who can see what and who can do what inside the system.

Roles and permissions

Roles define permissions and responsibilities assigned to users in the system. Each role controls what a user can see and do inside Unit Master.

From this page administrators can:

  • View existing roles See all roles that already exist in the system.
  • Add new roles Create new roles when new business functions are added.
  • Assign permissions Control which menus and actions each role is allowed to use.

By configuring roles correctly, you ensure that users only access the parts of the system that match their responsibilities.

Add new role

On the right side of the Roles page, click Add New Role:

This opens a form where you capture the details of the new role:

Fill in the fields, for example:

  • Role Name Enter a clear name for the role (for example Operations Officer).
  • Description Optionally describe what this role is used for.

When you are done, click Save:

This will create a new role that can later be assigned to users and given permissions.

Assign permissions to a role

After creating a role, you must assign the menus and actions that the role is allowed to perform. On the right side, click Add Permissions:

This opens the permissions window where you can configure access for the selected role:

Choose the menus and actions you want to allow:

  • Select permissions Tick the menus and operations (create, edit, approve, delete, etc.).
  • Press Save to confirm the permissions for this role.

After saving, you are taken to a page where you can view or adjust the permissions that have been assigned to the role:
